lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Eelyon.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Eelyon.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
What can I do for you?
**Eelyon is a task organiser designed to make your life easier!**
Display all the tasks in the list
Add a todo task to the list
You now have 1 tasks in the list
Add a deadline task to the list
You now have 1 tasks in the list
Add an event task to the list
You now have 1 tasks in the list
Delete a task from the list
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Find tasks in the list containing a specific keyword
Here are the tasks matching the keyword: <keyword>
Mark a specific task as done
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:
SEE YA LATER! COME BACK SOON!!!
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Executes the add command by adding the task to the task list and
* @param taskList The task list to add the task to.
* @param ui The UI instance to handle user interaction.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed within the task management system.
* Checks if the command signals an exit from the application.
* @return true if the command exits the application, false otherwise.
* Executes the command with the given task list and UI.
* @param taskList The task list on which the command operates.
* @param ui The UI instance to handle user interaction.
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui);
* Represents the type of a command. It validates and processes the command type
* based on the user input and manages valid command types.
private final String[] COMMAND_LIST = new String[]{
* @return The command type as a string.
* Sets the command type based on the input. If the input command is invalid,
* @param inputCommandType The input command type to be validated and set.
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the input command is not in the list of valid commands.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid Command! Try again.");
* Returns the end command string that corresponds to the given command type.
* @return The end command string for the given command type.
* Checks if the current command is valid.
* @return true if the command is valid, false otherwise.
* Sets the validity status of the current command.
* @param valid The validity status to be set for the command.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted (0-based).
* Executes the delete command by removing the task at the specified index
* from the task list. If the index is invalid, an error message is displayed.
* @param taskList The task list from which the task will be removed.
* @param ui The UI instance to handle user interaction.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Executes the exit command by setting the exit flag to true
* @param taskList The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui The UI instance to handle user interaction.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to find tasks containing a specific keyword.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in task descriptions.
* Executes the find command by searching for tasks that contain the keyword.
* It then prints the list of matching tasks.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to search within.
* @param ui       The user interface to handle output.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to display all tasks in the task list.
* Executes the list command by printing all tasks from the task list.
* @param taskList The task list whose tasks will be printed.
* @param ui The UI instance to handle user interaction.
public final void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to load a task into the task list.
* This is used for loading tasks from a saved text file
* Constructs a LoadDataCommand with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be loaded into the task list.
* Executes the load data command by adding the task to the task list.
* Similar to AddCommand, but does not output anything to the console
* @param taskList The task list to which the task will be added.
* @param ui The UI instance to handle user interaction (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command to mark a task as completed in the task list.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as completed (0-based).
* Executes the mark command by marking the task at the specified index
* as completed. If the index is invalid, an error message is displayed.
* @param taskList The task list containing the task to be marked.
* @param ui The UI instance to handle user interaction.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a command that does nothing.
* This is used as a fallback when an invalid command is encountered.
* This command does not perform any action when executed.
* Executes the null command, which does nothing.
* @param taskList The task list (not used in this command).
* @param ui The UI instance to handle user interaction (not used in this command).
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
// No operation is performed in this command
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not completed in the task list.
* Constructs an UnmarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index The index of the task to be unmarked (0-based).
* Executes the unmark command by unmarking the task at the specified index
* as not completed. If the index is invalid, an error message is displayed.
* @param taskList The task list containing the task to be unmarked.
* @param ui The UI instance to handle user interaction.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {
* Represents a task that has a deadline. Inherits from the Task class.
* Constructs a Deadline task with a description and a deadline time.

* @param by The deadline time by which the task should be completed.

* @return The deadline time as a string.
* Returns the string representation of the Deadline task.
* This includes the task type indicator, status, description, and the deadline time.
* @return The string representation of the task.

* @param to The end time of the event.

return new AddCommand(new Event(eventDescription, from, to));

* Prints a message after adding a task.

* @param size The size of the task list after adding.
public static void printAddTask(Task task, int size) {

* Prints a message after removing a task.

* Prints a message after marking a task as not done.
